article.headline: Rhode Island 65, Dayton 63
article.story: DAYTON, Ohio (AP) -- Dustin Hellenga caught an inbound pass from the baseline and hit a 3-pointer at the buzzer Wednesday night, giving resurgent Rhode Island a 65-63 victory over Dayton. Unlike the ending of its last game, Rhode Island (18-12, 7-9 Atlantic 10) made the most of its final shot. The Rams missed two shots in the closing seconds of a 57-55 loss to undefeated Saint Joseph's on Saturday, then sat on their home court dejected. Dayton (21-7, 11-4) has clinched its division's top seed for the conference tournament, which will be played on the Flyers' court next week. Rhode Island completed its regular season, and will play a first-round game in Dayton. Hellenga scored 18 points and led a 16-3 run that put Rhode Island ahead 59-52 with 7:20 to play. Hellenga hit a pair of jumpers and a 3-pointer to start the spurt. Dayton's Mark Jones made a pair of free throws that tied it at 62 with 45 seconds to go, and Sean Finn made the second of two free throws for a 63-62 lead with 6 seconds left. Dayton then fouled, forcing the Rams to inbound the ball. Dawan Robinson, who missed one of the final shots against No. 2 Saint Joseph's, passed the ball in from the baseline with 2.2 seconds left. Hellenga caught it in the left corner and made an off-balance shot over Ramod Marshall. Keith Waleskowski had 10 rebounds and 14 points, leading four Flyers in double figures.
